ygData.messageBody:
By that same reasoning bards should never get any equipment except magical
instruments or secondaries on charisma gear.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Friday, April 14, 2000 10:42 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] ugh, shutting bards out of lotto getting more
wides pread


On Fri, 14 Apr 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:

> I would imagine that the Haste effects jumping to 75% no matter which ones
> you combine is a bug. As such eventually its liable to get fixed,
probably
> sooner rather than later since its a bug that benefits players. Once this
> happens those lower end Haste items are not going to be as good for a bard
> as the high end ones, any more than they are for melee types.

If it gets fixed, it's even *more* reason for other melee
classes to get the high end haste items before us. Right now,
since item+song = max haste, a 30% haste item results in a 35%
net improvement for a bard (1.3 to 1.75) , but only 30% net
improvement for a melee class (1.0 to 1.3).

If it were fixed:

If a bard gets a 30% haste item and stacks it with his 30%
haste song, his net improvement is only 23% (from 1.3 to 1.6).

If a melee class gets a 30% haste item, his net improvement is
30% (1.0 to 1.3), i.e. more than a bard.

Couple this with a normal melee class doing more melee
damage/time than a bard, and it's even more compelling reason
for them to get priority over a bard.

And our song damage vastly exceeds our melee damage at max
haste anyway, so that part of the argument remains unchanged.

--
